bibl.title: Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

body.div1:
Commercial Agency of the United States, Boma, Congo Free State, Aug 5th, 1889 (Written at Caepeper, Virigina)
Mr, Emory H.Taunt TO THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE
Subject: Conditions of "Frait cure Mission" on the Congo River
Abstract of Contents >not clear< - <pb facs="20170614_135445"
Honorable W.F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir,
There are certain citizens of the United States noe on the Congo River. Missionaries belonging to a "Faith Cure Seat". Who, I fear, may become desbitaste? Without means to return home.
As min be seen by my despatch no.11, these people are now in anything but a purposerous condition. And are the members of this same mission in/ 85 or/86 were therefore upon the charity of the English Despatch, and by that society furrished With passages to Europe, I anticipating their coming to me for relief, respectfully
<pb facs="20170614_135519"
and instructive from the Department as to what action I am authorized to take in the matter. I am Sir:
Your Obident Servant Emory Taunt U.S. Cons.Agent Boma
